result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nelson R Sanchez Torres

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
[MK] cases #15CF410and #15CF414 called at 3:55pm. 
Defendant Nelson R Sanchez Torres in court, in custody, with Attorney Sylvie H Dahnert. ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Mr. Sanchez Torres waives his right to Preliminary Hearing in both cases; the Court accepts these waivers and binds Mr. Sanchez Torres over for Arraignment. 
Service of the Informations admitted; readings waived. 
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty " entered on Count #2 of Case #15CF410; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified (ADA Beck files the victim impact statement and restitution information); the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Case #15CF414-Count #2.

On Case #15CF410-Count #2, the Court withholds sentence, and places Mr. Sanchez Torres on Probation for three years, with conditions:

--to serve 30 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, to commence forthwith 
---Mr. Sanchez Torres is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further proces;  the Court authorizes transfer of this jail term to Milwaukee County conditional on there being no use of electronic monitoring for service of the jail term 
--to pay resitution to the Premier Bank of $17,752.56, joint and several with co-actor Leroy Durr if Mr. Durr is convicted 
--to undergo assessment, treatment, and counseling as required by the Agent
--no presence at any Premier Bank branch in Jefferson County
--no contact with Leroy Durr
--to maintain employment and/or education program as required by the Agent
--to pay costs, fees, assements and surcharges including the DNA surcharge plus $60 summons fee plus restitution surcharge

Days credit for time served:  35  days
Felony firearm warnings given
The Court notes that it is not ordering DNA sample provision in this case because it has been indicated that there is already a DNA sample on file for Mr. Sanchez Torres.
recess 4:15pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 8, 2016 at 03:45 pm.
Status conference on September 9, 2016 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Nelson R Sanchez Torres
Current: 701A W. MItchell St., Milwaukee, WI 53204 United States  (Effective: 08-09-2016)
Prior: 1820 W Wells St, Milwaukee, WI 53233

Cases 15CF410 & 15CF414 called at 1:22 pm [sf]
Defendant Nelson R Sanchez Torres in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office (PD will appoint counsel). Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Court reviews procedural posture of case.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $500.00 CASH bond to cover both files, with previous non-monetary conditions: 

Recess: 
NEXT: (1)  Status Conference scheduled for 9/9/16 at 10:00 am - send notices
Defendant in custody // Duplicate Original Warrant document returned from JCSD

Cases 15CF410 and 15CF414 called together at 2:10pm [mo]
Attorney Sylvie Helena Dahnert in court.   DA Susan Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Dahnert indicates that she was unable to contact Mr. Sanchez Torres despite attempts in doing so

The Court issues a capias on each file; the Court forfeits bail
recess: 2:12pm
Status conference on May 6, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on April 6, 2016 at 10:00 am.

[MK] cases #15CF410 & #15CF414 called at 1:38pm. 
Defendant Nelson R Sanchez Torres  appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek (PD will appoint counsel).  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Mr. Sanchez Torres verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaints is corret.
Service of Complaints admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $5,000  Signature Bond [applies to both cases], with conditions:
--no presence at any PremierBank location in Jefferson County
--no contact with Leroy Durr
recess 1:41pm. 


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 4/6/16 at 10:00am  (2) Status Conference on 5/6/16 at 2:00pm
Duplicate Original Warrant received from JCSD - Defendant is in custody

Cases 15CF410 & 15CF414 called together at 10:53 am [Clerk SH] (Cases were scheduled for initial appearance)
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Nelson R Sanchez Torres not in court. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
